context.p: The APPLICATION SETTINGS page enables you to perform the following tasks:

ul.li: Configure application settings: Create, store, and maintain application-level preferences in the application.
Configure mail settings: Set up mail server name and credentials, sender email address and name, and recipient email address details.

Customize regional options: Customize regional options such as the decimal places in dollar amounts and quantities, time and date formats, and date separators. REGIONAL CONFIGURATIONS lets you define application settings for dollar amount type, unit price, item quantity, date, and time formats. The following options must be set before the initial use of :
Decimal settings for dollar amounts, unit prices, and quantities to define the number of digits after the decimal.
Time format to define a standard time format. For example, HH:MM.
Date format to define a standard date format. For example, DD/MM/YYYY.
Date separator character to demarcate the day, month, and year.

li.p:
Configure the following MY TASKS CONFIGURATIONS settings:
Define the number of days to view notifications received within that range.
Define the number of filter windows to view notifications for the specific date range.
Enable the option of viewing historical records.
In the module menu, click Administration.
Expand System Configurations, and then click Application Settings.
The APPLICATION SETTINGS page is displayed.
Provide the required information in the fields as described in the following table.

row.entry: Enter the name that should be displayed as the tab name of the browser when the application is opened in the browser.

By default, a set of allowed file types are displayed. Optionally, enter file extensions of file types that can be uploaded into the application. Only files of the specified file types can be uploaded to the application in the document management system or as attachments in any form and when performing workflow transitions.
Max allowable Document Size in Attachment (in MB)
Enter the maximum size (in MB) of a file that can be uploaded as an attachment in a form in the application.
Enter the SMTP server IP address to enable the application to send email notifications to the configured SMTP server. For example, outlook.<company>.com.
Click Send Test Mail to verify the configured application SMTP server address. An error message is displayed if the configured SMTP server does not exist.
Enter the SMTP server user name.
Enter the password to secure the SMTP server.
Enter the SMTP server port number.
Select the check box to enable SSL.
Enter the official email address from which notifications will be sent to users from the application. For example, admin@<company>.com.
By default, the sender name is displayed as Administrator. If required, enter the name displayed as the sender's name when notifications are sent to users from the application.

The default email address is displayed as administrator@Mind.com. If required, enter the email address of the application administrator who is notified of the events in the application after the scheduled event.
Select the appropriate time zone applicable to the application.
Select the number of digits after the application's decimal for dollar amount-related fields.
Select the number of digits after the decimal for quantity-related fields in the application.
Select the number of digits after the decimal for price-related fields in the application.
Select the date format for the application. For example, dd/mm/yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy.
Select the date separator character. For example, / or -.
Select the format to display time. For example, hh:mm:ss or hh:mm:ss:tt, where hh corresponds to hours, mm to minutes, ss to seconds, and tt to AM/PM in a 12-hour format.

Enter the number of days for which the tasks must be displayed. You can enter any value between 1 to 30. The default value is set to 7.
All tasks falling within the defined number of days are displayed in the following locations:
The My Tasks section at the Mind user interface. For more information on viewing all Mind notifications from My Tasks, refer to the Notification Icon feature in the .
The MY TASKS page at the enterprise and project levels.
